original: Paṭṭhānapakaraṇa
analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa
translated: The Paṭṭhāna🔽The Triad-based Reversal Series

original: Dhammānuloma (1), Tikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (1)🔽1.18. Uppannattika
analyzed: dhamma anuloma tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi  uppanna ttika
translated: The triad on the present

original: Vibhaṅgavāra
analyzed: vibhaṅgavāra
translated: The Vibhaṅga section

original: Hetu🔽Uppanno dhammo uppannassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo—uppannā hetū sampayuttakānaṁ🔽khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe uppannā
analyzed: hetu  uppannaḥ dhammaḥ uppannassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayo uppannāḥ hetū sampayuttakāna  khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānañca rūpānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe uppannā
translated: Cause

original: hetū sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ kaṭattā ca rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: hetū sampayuttakānam khandhānam kaṭattā ca rūpānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A present phenomenon is a condition, as cause condition, for a present phenomenon. Present causes are a condition, as cause condition, for the associated aggregates and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness. At the moment of rebirth-linking, present causes are a condition, as cause condition, for the associated aggregates and for the kinds of materiality due to kamma performed.

original: Ārammaṇa🔽Uppanno dhammo uppannassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—uppannaṁ cakkhuṁ aniccato🔽dukkhato anattato vipassati, assādeti abhinandati, taṁ ārabbha rāgo uppajjati, diṭṭhi🔽uppajjati, vicikicchā …pe… uddhaccaṁ …pe… domanassaṁ uppajjati. Uppannaṁ sotaṁ …
analyzed: ārammaṇa  uppannaḥ dhammaḥ uppannassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo uppannam cakkhum aniccato  dukkhataḥ anattataḥ vipassati assādeti abhinandati tam ārabbha rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi  uppajjati vicikicchā pe uddhaccam pe domanassam uppajjati uppannam sotam
translated: Object

original: ghānaṁ … jivhaṁ … kāyaṁ … rūpe … sadde … gandhe … rase … phoṭṭhabbe … vatthuṁ … uppanne
analyzed: ghānam jivham kāyam rūpe sadde gandhe rase phoṭṭhabbe vatthum uppanne
translated: A present phenomenon is a condition, as object condition, for a present phenomenon. One who sees the eye as impermanent … as painful … as not self … One who delights in the eye, welcomes it, and remains holding to it, greed arises in him. A view arises … doubt … uncertainty … agitation … sorrow arises in him in regard to the eye. One who sees the ear … the nose … the tongue … the body … visible objects … sounds … odours … flavours … tangible objects … the materiality of the physical basis … the present

original: khandhe aniccato dukkhato anattato vipassati …pe… domanassaṁ uppajjati. Dibbena cakkhunā
analyzed: khandhe aniccataḥ dukkhataḥ anattataḥ vipassati pe domanassam uppajjati dibbena cakkhunā
translated: When he sees a form with the divine eye, …

original: rūpaṁ passati, dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddaṁ suṇāti, rūpāyatanaṁ cakkhuviññāṇassa …pe…
analyzed: rūpam passati dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddam suṇāti rūpa āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇassa pe
translated: When he hears a sound with the divine ear element, …

original: phoṭṭhabbāyatanaṁ kāyaviññāṇassa …pe… uppannā khandhā iddhividhañāṇassa, āvajjanāya
analyzed: phoṭṭhabba āyatanam kāya viññāṇassa pe uppannā khandhāḥ iddhividha ñāṇassa āvajjanāya
translated: When he comprehends the arisen aggregates with the knowledge of the kinds of supernormal power, …

original: ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: is a condition, as object condition, for the adverting.

original: Anuppanno dhammo uppannassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—anuppanne rūpe …
analyzed: anuppannaḥ dhammaḥ uppannassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ anuppanne rūpe
translated: An unarisen state is a condition, as object condition, for an arisen state: When unarisen form …🔽sound … odour … flavour … tangible datum …

original: sadde … gandhe … rase … phoṭṭhabbe … anuppanne khandhe aniccato dukkhato anattato
analyzed: sadde gandhe rase phoṭṭhabbe anuppanne khandhe aniccataḥ dukkhataḥ anattataḥ
translated: When he contemplates as impermanent, as suffering, or as nonself, …

original: vipassati …pe… domanassaṁ uppajjati. Anuppannā khandhā iddhividhañāṇassa, cetopariyañāṇassa,
analyzed: vipassati pe domanassam uppajjati anuppannā khandhāḥ iddhividha ñāṇassa cetas pariya ñāṇassa
translated: When the unarisen aggregates are comprehended with the knowledge of the kinds of supernormal power, with the knowledge of penetration of minds,

original: anāgataṁsañāṇassa, āvajjanāya ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: anāgata sañāṇassa āvajjanāya ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo
translated: with knowledge of past lives, … is a condition, as object condition, for the adverting.

original: Uppādī dhammo uppannassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—uppādiṁ cakkhuṁ …pe…
analyzed: uppādī dhammaḥ uppannassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayouppādim cakkhum pe
translated: An arising state is a condition, as object condition, for an arisen state: When the arising eye …

original: kāyaṁ … rūpe … gandhe … rase … phoṭṭhabbe … vatthuṁ … uppādī khandhe aniccato dukkhato🔽anattato …pe… domanassaṁ uppajjati. Uppādī khandhā iddhividhañāṇassa, cetopariyañāṇassa,
analyzed: kāyam rūpe gandhe rase phoṭṭhabbe vatthum uppādī khandhe aniccataḥ dukkhataḥ  anattataḥ pe domanassam uppajjati uppādī khandhāḥ iddhividha ñāṇassa cetopariya ñāṇassa
translated: the body … form … sound … smell … taste … tangible … the physical basis … the arising of the aggregates as object is a condition, as support condition, for joy.

original: anāgataṁsañāṇassa, āvajjanāya ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: anāgata sañāṇassa āvajjanāya ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo
translated: The arising of the aggregates is a condition, as support condition, for the knowledge of the mind-made body, for the knowledge of the future, for adverting.

original: Adhipati
analyzed: adhipati
translated: Dominant

original: Uppanno dhammo uppannassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇādhipati, sahajātādhipati.
analyzed: uppannaḥ dhammaḥ uppannassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati sahajāta adhipati
translated: An arisen factor is a condition, as a dominant condition, for an arisen factor. There is a dominant condition as object and a dominant condition as co-nascence.

original: Ārammaṇādhipati—uppannaṁ cakkhuṁ garuṁ katvā assādeti abhinandati, taṁ garuṁ katvā🔽rāgo uppajjati, diṭṭhi uppajjati. Uppannaṁ sotaṁ … ghānaṁ … jivhaṁ … kāyaṁ … rūpe🔽… sadde … gandhe … rase … phoṭṭhabbe … vatthuṁ … uppanne khandhe garuṁ katvā assādeti
analyzed: ārammaṇa adhipati uppannam cakkhum garum katvā assādeti abhinandati tam garum katvā  rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi uppajjati uppannam sotam ghānam jivham kāyam rūpe  sadde gandhe rase phoṭṭhabbe vatthum uppanne khandhe garum katvā assādeti
translated: Dominant as object: having made much of an arisen eye, one exalts it and delights in it, and because of that🔽lust arises, perception of permanence arises. Having made much of an arisen ear … nose … tongue … body … form …🔽sound … smell … taste … tangible … the physical basis … the arising of the aggregates, one exalts it and delights in it, and because of that lust arises …

original: abhinandati, taṁ garuṁ katvā rāgo uppajjati …pe…. Sahajātādhipati—uppannā adhipati
analyzed: abhinandati tam garum katvā rāgaḥ uppajjati pe sahajāta adhipati uppannāḥ adhipati
translated: Dominant as co-nascence: an arisen dominant factor is a condition, as a dominant condition, for an arisen factor.

original: sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo.🔽Anuppanno dhammo uppannassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo. Ārammaṇādhipati—anuppanne
analyzed: sampayuttakānam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānañca rūpānam adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ  anuppannaḥ dhammaḥ uppannassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati anuppanne
translated: It is a condition, as predominance condition, for the associated aggregates and for the kinds of materiality derived from the great primaries.

original: rūpe … sadde … gandhe … rase … phoṭṭhabbe … anuppanne khandhe garuṁ katvā assādeti
analyzed: rūpe sadde gandhe rase phoṭṭhabbe anuppanne khandhe garum katvā assādeti
translated: An unarisen state is a condition, as predominance condition, for an arisen state. Predominance as object: When someone, having given importance to unarisen materiality … to unarisen sound … to unarisen odour … to unarisen flavour … to unarisen tangible data … to unarisen aggregates …

original: abhinandati, taṁ garuṁ katvā rāgo uppajjati, diṭṭhi uppajjati.
analyzed: abhinandati tam garum katvā rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi uppajjati
translated: apprehends it as “I” and “mine,” and so lust arises, or a view arises,

original: Uppādī dhammo uppannassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo. Ārammaṇādhipati—uppādiṁ
analyzed: uppādī dhammaḥ uppannassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati uppādi
translated: An arisen state is a condition, as predominance condition, for an arisen state. Predominance as object: When someone, having given importance to arisen

original: cakkhuṁ …pe… kāyaṁ … rūpe …pe… phoṭṭhabbe … vatthuṁ … uppādī khandhe garuṁ katvā
analyzed: cakkhum pe kāyam rūpe pe phoṭṭhabbe vatthum uppādī khandhe garum katvā
translated: eye … ear … nose … tongue … body … materiality … sound … odour … flavour … tangible data … the physical basis … arisen aggregates …

original: assādeti abhinandati, taṁ garuṁ katvā rāgo uppajjati, diṭṭhi uppajjati.
analyzed: assādeti abhinandati tam garum katvā rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi uppajjati
translated: apprehends them as “I” and “mine,” and so lust arises, or a view arises,

original: Sahajāta
analyzed: sahajāta
translated: Conascence

original: Uppanno dhammo uppannassa dhammassa sahajātapaccayena paccayo—uppanno eko khandho
analyzed: uppannaḥ dhammaḥ uppannassa dhammassa sahajāta paccayena paccayo uppannaḥ ekaḥ khandho
translated: An arisen state is a condition, as conascence condition, for an arisen state. One aggregate is a condition, as conascence condition, for the three aggregates.

original: tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ sahajātapaccayena paccayo …pe…
analyzed: tiṇṇannam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānam sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ pe
translated: The three constituents are a condition, as conascence condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: dve khandhā dvinnaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ sahajātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: dve khandhāḥ dvinnam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānam ca rūpānam sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Two constituents are a condition, as conascence condition, for the two constituents and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: Paṭisandhikkhaṇe uppanno eko khandho tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ kaṭattā ca rūpānaṁ sahajātapaccayena
analyzed: paṭisandhi khaṇe uppannaḥ ekaḥ khandhaḥ tiṇṇannam khandhānam kaṭattā ca rūpānam sahajāta paccayena
translated: At the moment of rebirth-linking, the one constituent that has arisen is a condition, as conascence condition, for the three constituents and for the kinds of materiality derived from the great primaries.

original: paccayo …pe… dve khandhā dvinnaṁ khandhānaṁ kaṭattā ca rūpānaṁ sahajātapaccayena
analyzed: paccayaḥ pe dve khandhāḥ dvinnam khandhānam kaṭattā ca rūpānam sahajāta paccayena
translated: … Two constituents are a condition, as conascence condition, for the two constituents and for the kinds of materiality derived from the great primaries.

original: paccayo. Khandhā vatthussa sahajātapaccayena paccayo. Vatthu khandhānaṁ sahajātapaccayena🔽paccayo. Ekaṁ mahābhūtaṁ tiṇṇannaṁ mahābhūtānaṁ sahajātapaccayena paccayo …pe… dve
analyzed: paccayaḥ khandhāḥ vatthussa sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ vatthu khandhānam sahajāta paccayena  paccayaḥ ekam mahābhūtam tiṇṇannam mahābhūtānam sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve
translated: The constituents are a condition, as conascence condition, for the physical basis. The physical basis is a condition, as conascence condition, for the constituents.

original: mahābhūtā …pe… mahābhūtā cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ kaṭattārūpānaṁ upādārūpānaṁ sahajātapaccayena
analyzed: mahābhūtā pe mahābhūtā citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam kaṭattā rūpānam upādā rūpānam sahajāta paccayena
translated: One great primary is a condition, as conascence condition, for the three great primaries. … Two great primaries are a condition, as conascence condition, for the two great primaries. … The great primaries are a condition, as conascence condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness, for the materiality of the physical heart-basis, and for the materiality derived from the great primaries.

original: paccayo. bāhiraṁ … āhārasamuṭṭhānaṁ … utusamuṭṭhānaṁ … asaññasattānaṁ ekaṁ mahābhūtaṁ
analyzed: paccayaḥ bāhiram āhāra samuṭṭhānam utu samuṭṭhānam asaññasattānam ekam mahābhūta
translated: The four great elements are a condition, as a condition by way of decisive support, for the derived materiality that arises together with them.

original: …pe… dve mahābhūtā …pe… mahābhūtā kaṭattārūpānaṁ upādārūpānaṁ sahajātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: pe dve mahābhūtā pe mahābhūtā kaṭattā rūpānaṃ upādā rūpānaṃ sahajāta paccayena paccayo
translated: The four great elements are a condition, as a condition by way of decisive support, for the derived materiality that originates from the four great elements.

original: Aññamañña🔽Uppanno dhammo uppannassa dhammassa aññamaññapaccayena paccayo—uppanno eko khandho
analyzed: aññamañña  uppannaḥ dhammaḥ uppannassa dhammassa aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ uppannaḥ ekaḥ khandho
translated: Mutual

analyzed: tiṇṇannam khandhānam aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve khandhā pe paṭisandhi kkhaṇe

One of the aggregates is a condition, as a condition by way of mutual dependence, for three of the aggregates. Two of the aggregates are a condition, as a condition by way of mutual dependence, for two of the aggregates. At the moment of rebirth-linking

analyzed: uppannaḥ ekaḥ khandho tiṇṇannam khandhānam vatthussa ca aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ  dve khandhā pe khandhā vatthussa aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ vatthu khandhāna
translated: one of the aggregates is a condition, as a condition by way of mutual dependence, for the three aggregates and for the physical basis.🔽Two of the aggregates are a condition, as a condition by way of mutual dependence, for the two aggregates and for the physical basis. original: aññamaññapaccayena paccayo. Ekaṁ mahābhūtaṁ …pe… bāhiraṁ … āhārasamuṭṭhānaṁ … utusamuṭṭhānaṁ
analyzed: aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ ekam mahābhūtam pe bāhiram āhāra samuṭṭhānam utu samuṭṭhāna
translated: One of the great essentials is a condition, as a condition by way of mutual dependence, for the three great essentials. Two of the great essentials are a condition, as a condition by way of mutual dependence, for the two great essentials. The great essentials are a condition, as a condition by way of mutual dependence, for the derived materiality that originates from the great essentials. analyzed: asaññasattānam ekam mahābhūtam tiṇṇannam mahābhūtānam aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ

analyzed: nissaya  uppannaḥ dhammaḥ uppannassa dhammassa nissaya paccayena paccayo uppannaḥ ekaḥ khandho
translated: Support

analyzed: tiṇṇannam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānaṃ nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve  khandhā pe paṭisandhikkhaṇe pe khandhā vatthussa pe vatthu khandhānam pe  ekam mahābhūtam pe bāhiram āhāra samuṭṭhānam utu samuṭṭhānam  ekam mahābhūtam pe mahābhūtā citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam kaṭattā rūpānam upādā rūpānam
translated: An arisen formation is related to an arisen formation as support condition, a single aggregate is related to three aggregates and to materiality originated by consciousness as support condition, two aggregates are related to two aggregates and to materiality originated by consciousness as support condition, three aggregates are related to three aggregates and to materiality originated by consciousness as support condition, four aggregates are related to four aggregates and to materiality originated by consciousness as support condition. It is a condition, as the support condition, for the conceit ‘I am’ and for the perception ‘I am.’🔽The support condition as object is a condition, as the support condition, for the jhāna, insight, path,

original: Uppannaṁ bhojanaṁ …pe… senāsanaṁ upanissāya jhānaṁ uppādeti vipassanaṁ …pe… maggaṁ
analyzed: uppannam bhojanam pe senāsanam upanissāya jhānam uppādeti vipassanam pe magga
translated: direct-knowledge, and attainment that have arisen. It is a condition, as the support condition, for the conceit ‘I am’ and for the perception ‘I am.’🔽The support condition as object is a condition, as the support condition, for the jhāna, insight, path,🔽direct-knowledge, and attainment that have arisen. It is a condition, as the support condition, for the conceit ‘I am’ and for the perception ‘I am.’

original: …pe… abhiññaṁ …pe… samāpattiṁ uppādeti, mānaṁ jappeti, diṭṭhiṁ gaṇhāti. Uppannaṁ
analyzed: pe abhiññam pe samāpattim uppādeti mānam jappeti diṭṭhim gaṇhāti uppanna
translated: The support condition as object is a condition, as the support condition, for the jhāna, insight, path,🔽direct-knowledge, and attainment that have arisen. It is a condition, as the support condition, for the conceit ‘I am’ and for the perception ‘I am.’

original: utu … bhojanaṁ … senāsanaṁ uppannāya saddhāya …pe… paññāya, kāyikassa sukhassa, kāyikassa
analyzed: utu bhojanam senāsanam uppannāya saddhāya pe paññāya kāyikassa sukhassa kāyikassa
translated: The support condition as object is a condition, as the support condition, for the jhāna, insight, path,🔽direct-knowledge, and attainment that have arisen. It is a condition, as the support condition, for the conceit ‘I am’ and for the perception ‘I am.’

original: dukkhassa, maggassa, phalasamāpattiyā upanissayapaccayena paccayo.🔽Anuppanno dhammo uppannassa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇūpanissayo,
analyzed: dukkhassa maggassa phala samāpattiyāḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ  anuppannaḥ dhammaḥ uppannassa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa upanissayaḥ
translated: The support condition as object is a condition, as the support condition, for the jhāna, insight, path,🔽direct-knowledge, and attainment that have arisen. It is a condition, as the support condition, for the conceit ‘I am’ and for the perception ‘I am.’🔽The support condition as object is a condition, as the support condition, for the jhāna, insight, path,🔽direct-knowledge, and attainment that have arisen. It is a condition, as the support condition, for the conceit ‘I am’ and for the perception ‘I am.’

original: pakatūpanissayo …pe…. Pakatūpanissayo—anuppannaṁ vaṇṇasampadaṁ patthayamāno dānaṁ
analyzed: pakata upanissayaḥ pe pakata upanissayaḥ anuppannam vaṇṇa sampadam patthayamānaḥ dāna
translated: The support condition as object is a condition, as the support condition, for the jhāna, insight

original: deti, sīlaṁ samādiyati, uposathakammaṁ karoti. Anuppannaṁ saddasampadaṁ … gandhasampadaṁ🔽… rasasampadaṁ … phoṭṭhabbasampadaṁ … anuppanne khandhe patthayamāno dānaṁ deti,
analyzed: deti sīlam samādiyati uposatha kammam karoti anuppannam sadda sampadam gandha sampada  rasa sampadam phoṭṭhabba sampadam anuppanne khandhe patthayamānaḥ dānam deti
translated: he gives a gift, he undertakes the precepts, he performs the Uposatha ceremony.🔽He gives a gift, hoping for the arising of the non-arisen wealth of sound …🔽the wealth of smell … the wealth of taste … the wealth of tangibles … the wealth of thoughts.

original: sīlaṁ samādiyati, uposathakammaṁ karoti. Anuppannā vaṇṇasampadā …pe… anuppannā khandhā🔽uppannāya saddhāya …pe… paññāya, kāyikassa sukhassa, kāyikassa dukkhassa, maggassa,🔽phalasamāpattiyā upanissayapaccayena paccayo.🔽Uppādī dhammo uppannassa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇūpanissayo,🔽pakatūpanissayo …pe…. Pakatūpanissayo—uppādiṁ cakkhusampadaṁ patthayamāno dānaṁ deti,🔽sīlaṁ samādiyati, uposathakammaṁ karoti. Uppādiṁ sotasampadaṁ …pe… kāyasampadaṁ …pe…

original: vaṇṇasampadaṁ … gandhasampadaṁ … rasasampadaṁ … phoṭṭhabbasampadaṁ … uppādī khandhe
analyzed: vaṇṇa sampadam gandha sampadam rasa sampadam phoṭṭhabba sampadam uppādī khandhe
translated: the perfection of colour … the perfection of smell … the perfection of taste … the perfection of tangibility … the aggregates that arise

original: patthayamāno dānaṁ deti, sīlaṁ samādiyati, uposathakammaṁ karoti. Uppādī cakkhusampadā
analyzed: patthayamānaḥ dānam deti sīlam samādiyati uposatha kammam karoti uppādī cakkhu sampadā
translated: He gives a gift, undertakes the precepts, or observes the Uposatha day, aiming at the acquisition of the beauty aggregate,🔽the sound aggregate, the smell aggregate, the taste aggregate, or the tangible-object aggregate.🔽The acquisition of the eye faculty …

original: …pe… kāyasampadā … vaṇṇasampadā …pe… phoṭṭhabbasampadā … uppādī khandhā uppannāya
analyzed: pe kāya sampadā vaṇṇa sampadā pe phoṭṭhabba sampadā uppādī khandhāḥ uppannāya
translated: the body faculty … the beauty aggregate … the tangible-object aggregate …

original: saddhāya …pe… paññāya, kāyikassa sukhassa, kāyikassa dukkhassa, maggassa, phalasamāpattiyā
analyzed: saddhāya pe paññāya kāyikassa sukhassa kāyikassa dukkhassa maggassa phala samāpattiyā
translated: the faith aggregate … the concentration aggregate … the wisdom aggregate … bodily pleasure … bodily pain … the path … the attainment of the fruit is related to the prior condition of the faith aggregate … the concentration aggregate … the wisdom aggregate … bodily pleasure … bodily pain … the path … the attainment of the fruit.

original: upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The prior condition is a condition by way of the prior condition condition.

original: Purejāta🔽Uppanno dhammo uppannassa dhammassa purejātapaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇapurejātaṁ,🔽vatthupurejātaṁ. Ārammaṇapurejātaṁ—cakkhuṁ …pe… vatthuṁ aniccato dukkhato anattato
analyzed: purā jāta  uppannaḥ dhammaḥ uppannassa dhammassa purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa purejāta  vatthu purejātaḥ ārammaṇa purejāta cakkhum pe vatthum aniccataḥ dukkhataḥ anattataḥ
translated: Prior

original: vipassati, assādeti abhinandati, taṁ ārabbha rāgo uppajjati …pe… domanassaṁ uppajjati
analyzed: vipassati assādeti abhinandati tam ārabbha rāgaḥ uppajjati pe domanassam uppajjati
translated: A past phenomenon is a condition, by way of the prior condition condition, for a present phenomenon. The object condition, the support condition. The object condition: One contemplates a form as impermanent, as suffering, as a disease, as a tumour, as a barb, as a calamity, as an affliction, as alien, as disintegrating, as empty, as non-self. One becomes dispassionate towards it, it doesn’t delight one, one doesn’t enjoy it or take pleasure in it. Aversion arises in relation to it, or anger, or rage, or hate, or indignation, or revenge, or resentment, or hostility, or contempt, or domineering, or jealousy, or stinginess, or deceit, or fraud, or obstinacy, or arrogance, or pride, or conceit, or vanity, or negligence.

original: dibbena cakkhunā rūpaṁ passati, dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddaṁ suṇāti, rūpāyatanaṁ cakkhuviññāṇassa🔽…pe… phoṭṭhabbāyatanaṁ kāyaviññāṇassa purejātapaccayena paccayo. Vatthupurejātaṁ—cakkhāyatanaṁ
analyzed: dibbena cakkhunā rūpam passati dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddam suṇāti rūpa āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇassa  pe phoṭṭhabba āyatanam kāya viññāṇassa purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ vatthu purejāta cakkhu āyatana
translated: With the divine eye he sees visible forms. With the divine ear element he hears sounds. The visible-form base is related to eye-consciousness as a preceding condition.

original: cakkhuviññāṇassa …pe… vatthu uppannānaṁ khandhānaṁ purejātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇassa pe vatthu uppannānam khandhānam purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: … The tangible-form base is related to body-consciousness as a preceding condition. The physical basis as a preceding condition: the eye base is related to eye-consciousness … The physical basis is related to the arisen aggregates as a preceding condition.

original: Pacchājāta
analyzed: pacchājāta
translated: Post-nascence

original: Uppanno dhammo uppannassa dhammassa pacchājātapaccayena paccayo—pacchājātā uppannā khandhā purejātassa imassa kāyassa pacchājātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: uppannaḥ dhammaḥ uppannassa dhammassa pacchājāta paccayena paccaya upacchājātāḥ uppannāḥ khandhāḥ purejātassa imassa kāyassa pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: An arisen states is a condition, as post-nascence condition, for an arisen state. Post-nascent arisen aggregates are related to this pre-arisen body as a post-nascence condition.

original: Kamma🔽Uppanno dhammo uppannassa dhammassa kammapaccayena paccayo—uppannā cetanā sampayuttakānaṁ🔽khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe
analyzed: kamma  uppannaḥ dhammaḥ uppannassa dhammassa kamma paccayena paccayaḥ uppannā cetanā  khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe
translated: Kamma🔽An arisen state is a condition, as kamma condition, for an arisen state. Arisen volition is related to the associated aggregates and to the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness as a kamma condition. At the moment of rebirth-linking

original: uppannā cetanā sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ kaṭattā ca rūpānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: uppannā cetanā sampayuttakānam khandhānam kaṭattā ca rūpānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: arisen volition is related to the associated aggregates and to the kinds of materiality due to kamma-formation as a kamma condition.

original: Vipāka
analyzed: vipāka
translated: Result

original: Uppanno dhammo uppannassa dhammassa vipākapaccayena paccayo—vipāko uppanno eko khandho🔽tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ vipākapaccayena paccayo …pe… dve🔽khandhā …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe uppanno eko khandho tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ kaṭattā ca
analyzed: uppannaḥ dhammaḥ uppannassa dhammassa vipāka paccayena paccayaḥ vipākaḥ uppannaḥ ekaḥ khandho  tiṇṇannam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānañca rūpānam vipāka paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve  khandhāḥ pe paṭisandhi kkhaṇe uppannaḥ ekaḥ khandho tiṇṇannam khandhānam kaṭattā ca
translated: A present state is a condition, as a ripening condition, for a present state. A ripening consciousness is a condition, as a ripening condition, for the three resultant aggregates and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness. Two aggregates …

original: rūpānaṁ …pe… dve khandhā …pe… khandhā vatthussa vipākapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: rūpānam pe dve khandhāḥ pe khandhāḥ vatthussa vipāka paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: At the moment of rebirth-linking, a single aggregate is a condition, as a ripening condition, for the three aggregates and for the kinds of materiality due to kamma performed. Two aggregates …

original: Āhāra🔽Uppanno dhammo uppannassa dhammassa āhārapaccayena paccayo—uppannā āhārā sampayuttakānaṁ
analyzed: āhāra  uppannaḥ dhammaḥ uppannassa dhammassa āhāra paccayena paccayo uppannāḥ āhārāḥ sampayuttakāna
translated: The aggregates are a condition, as a ripening condition, for the physical heart basis.

original: khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ āhārapaccayena paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe
analyzed: khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānaṃ āhāra paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe
translated: As nutriment: A present state is a condition, as a nutriment condition, for a present state. Present nutriments are a condition, as a nutriment condition, for the associated aggregates and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness. At the moment of rebirth-linking …

original: …pe…. Kabaḷīkāro āhāro—imassa kāyassa āhārapaccayena paccayo.🔽Indriya
analyzed: pe kabaḷīkāro āhāro imassa kāyassa āhāra paccayena paccayo  indriya
translated: Physical nutriment is a condition, as a nutriment condition, for this body.

original: Uppanno dhammo uppannassa dhammassa indriyapaccayena paccayo—uppannā indriyā sampayuttakānaṁ
analyzed: uppannaḥ dhammaḥ uppannassa dhammassa indriya paccayena paccayo uppannāḥ indriyāḥ sampayuttakāna
translated: As a faculty: A present state is a condition, as a faculty condition, for a present state. Present faculties are a condition, as a faculty condition, for the associated aggregates and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ indriyapaccayena paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe🔽…pe… cakkhundriyaṁ cakkhuviññāṇassa …pe… kāyindriyaṁ kāyaviññāṇassa …pe… rūpajīvitindriyaṁ
analyzed: khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānaṃ indriya paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe  pe cakkhu indriyam cakkhu viññāṇassa pe kāyindriyam kāya viññāṇassa pe rūpa jīvitindriya
translated: The faculties are a condition, by faculty conditionality, for the aggregates and for the kinds of materiality that originate with consciousness. At the moment of rebirth-linking

original: kaṭattārūpānaṁ indriyapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: indriya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: … the eye faculty is a condition, by faculty conditionality, for eye-consciousness … the body faculty is a condition, by faculty conditionality, for body-consciousness … the material life faculty is a condition, by faculty conditionality, for the kinds of materiality that originate with consciousness.🔽The material life faculty is a condition, by faculty conditionality, for the kinds of materiality that originate with nutriment.

original: Jhānādi
analyzed: jhāna ādi
translated: Jhana, etc.

original: Uppanno dhammo uppannassa dhammassa jhānapaccayena paccayo … maggapaccayena paccayo
analyzed: uppannaḥ dhammaḥ uppannassa dhammassa jhāna paccayena paccayaḥ magga paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: An arisen state is a condition, by jhāna conditionality, for an arisen state … by path conditionality, for an arisen state …

original: … sampayuttapaccayena paccayo … vippayuttapaccayena paccayo— sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ,
analyzed: sampayutta paccayena paccayaḥ vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta purejāta
translated: by association conditionality, for an arisen state … by dissociation conditionality, for an arisen state. Conascence, prenascence,

original: pacchājātaṁ. Sahajātā—uppannā khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena🔽paccayo. Paṭisandhikkhaṇe uppannā khandhā kaṭattārūpānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: pacchājāta sahajāta auppannā khandhā citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam vippayutta paccayena  paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe uppannā khandhā kaṭattā rūpānam vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: postnascence. Conascence: the arisen aggregates are a condition, by dissociation conditionality, for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness. At the moment of rebirth-linking the aggregates are a condition, by dissociation conditionality, for the kinds of materiality due to kamma performed.

original: Khandhā vatthussa, vatthu khandhānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena paccayo. Purejātaṁ—cakkhāyatanaṁ
analyzed: khandhāḥ vatthussa vatthu khandhānam vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ purejāta cakkhāyatana
translated: The aggregates are a condition, by dissociation conditionality, for the physical basis, and the physical basis is a condition, by dissociation conditionality, for the aggregates. Prenascence: the eye base is a condition, by dissociation conditionality,

original: cakkhuviññāṇassa …pe… kāyāyatanaṁ kāyaviññāṇassa … vatthu uppannānaṁ khandhānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena
analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇassa pe kāya āyatanam kāya viññāṇassa vatthu uppannānam khandhānam vippayutta paccayena
translated: The eye base is a condition, by way of a condition not directly related, for eye-consciousness … The body base is a condition, by way of a condition not directly related, for body-consciousness … The physical body is a condition, by way of a condition not directly related, for the arisen aggregates.

original: paccayo. Pacchājātā—uppannā khandhā purejātassa imassa kāyassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccayaḥ pacchājāta auppannā khandhā purejātassa imassa kāyassa vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Postnascence: The arisen aggregates are a condition, by way of a condition not directly related, for this pre-arisen body.

original: Atthi🔽Uppanno dhammo uppannassa dhammassa atthipaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ,
analyzed: atthi  uppannaḥ dhammaḥ uppannassa dhammassa atthi paccayena paccayo sahajāta purejāta
translated: Existence🔽An arisen phenomenon is a condition, by way of a condition of existence, for an arisen phenomenon: conascence, prenascence,

original: pacchājātaṁ, āhāraṁ, indriyaṁ. Sahajāto—uppanno eko khandho tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ🔽cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo …pe… dve khandhā …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe
analyzed: pacchājātaḥ āhāraḥ indriya sahajāta uppannaḥ ekaḥ khandho tiṇṇannam khandhānam  citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānaṃ atthi paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve khandhā pe paṭisandhi kkhaṇe
translated: postnascence, nutriment, and faculty. Conascence: An arisen one aggregate is a condition, by way of a condition of existence, for three aggregates and for the form that is the result of consciousness. … Two aggregates are a condition, by way of a condition of existence, for two aggregates and for the form that is the result of consciousness. … At the moment of rebirth-linking …🔽… one of the great essentials is a condition, by way of a condition of existence, for the other three great essentials and for the form that is the result of consciousness. … An external great essential is a condition, by way of a condition of existence, for the other three great essentials and for the form that is the result of consciousness. … Nutriment-originated form is a condition, by way of a condition of existence, for the other three great essentials and for the form that is the result of consciousness. … Temperature-originated form is a condition, by way of a condition of existence, for the other three great essentials and for the form that is the result of consciousness. … For the non-percipient beings …

original: …pe… ekaṁ mahābhūtaṁ …pe… bāhiraṁ … āhārasamuṭṭhānaṁ … utusamuṭṭhānaṁ … asaññasattānaṁ🔽…pe…. Purejātaṁ—cakkhuṁ aniccato …pe… vatthuṁ aniccato …pe… domanassaṁ uppajjati,
analyzed: pe ekam mahābhūtam pe bāhiram āhāra samuṭṭhānam utu samuṭṭhānam 🔽pe purejāta cakkhum aniccatas pe vatthum aniccatas pe domanassam uppajjati
translated: Prenascence: The eye is a condition, by way of a condition of existence, for the arisen eye-consciousness element and for the states associated with it. … The ear … The nose … The tongue … The body … Visible form … Sound … Odour … Flavour … The body-intimation … The mind-object … The visible-data base … The sound base … The odour base … The flavour base … The tangible-data base … The mind base … The mental-data base is a condition, by way of a condition of existence, for the arisen mind-consciousness element and for the states associated with it.

original: dibbena cakkhunā rūpaṁ passati, dibbāya sotudhātuyā saddaṁ suṇāti, rūpāyatanaṁ cakkhuviññāṇassa
analyzed: dibbena cakkhunā rūpam passati dibbāya sotu dhātuyā saddam suṇāti rūpa āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇassa
translated: With the divine eye he sees visible forms, with the divine ear element he hears sounds, the visible form base is for eye-consciousness🔽… the tangible-object base is for body-consciousness. The eye base is for eye-consciousness

original: …pe… phoṭṭhabbāyatanaṁ kāyaviññāṇassa atthipaccayena paccayo. Cakkhāyatanaṁ cakkhuviññāṇassa🔽…pe… kāyāyatanaṁ kāyaviññāṇassa …pe… vatthu uppannānaṁ khandhānaṁ atthipaccayena
analyzed: pe phoṭṭhabba āyatanam kāya viññāṇassa atthi paccayena paccayaḥ cakkhu āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇassa  pe kāya āyatanam kāya viññāṇassa pe vatthu uppannānam khandhānam atthi paccayena
translated: … the body base is for body-consciousness. The physical basis is for the arisen aggregates.

original: paccayo. Pacchājātā—uppannā khandhā purejātassa imassa kāyassa atthipaccayena paccayo.🔽Kabaḷīkāro āhāro—imassa kāyassa atthipaccayena paccayo. Rūpajīvitindriyaṁ—kaṭattārūpānaṁ
analyzed: paccayaḥ pacchājāta auppannā khandhā purejātassa imassa kāyassa atthi paccayena paccayaḥ  kabaḷīkāraḥ āhāraḥ imassa kāyassa atthi paccayena paccayo
translated: Postnascence: The arisen aggregates are for the prenascent of this body.

original: atthipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: atthi paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Physical nutriment is for this body. The material life faculty is for the material phenomena.

original: Avigata
analyzed: avigata
translated: Non-disappearance

original: Uppanno dhammo uppannassa dhammassa avigatapaccayena paccayo …pe….
analyzed: uppannaḥ dhammaḥ uppannassa dhammassa avigata paccayena paccayaḥ pe
translated: An arisen states is for an arisen state as non-disappearance condition.

original: Saṅkhyāvāra
analyzed: saṅkhyāvāra
translated: The section on enumeration

original: Suddha
analyzed: suddha
translated: Pure

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi, sahajāte ekaṁ, aññamaññe ekaṁ, nissaye
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi sahajāte eka aññamaññe eka nissaye
translated: In the case of root cause, there is one; in the case of object, three; in the case of predominance, three; in the case of conascence, one; in the case of mutuality, one; in the case of support, in the case of prenascence, in the case of postnascence, in the case of nutriment, in the case of faculty, in the case of jhāna, in the case of path, in the case of association, in the case of presence, in the case of non-disappearance, there is one.

original: ekaṁ, upanissaye tīṇi, purejāte ekaṁ, pacchājāte kamme vipāke āhāre indriye jhāne
analyzed: eka upanissaye tīṇi purejāte eka pacchājāte kamme vipāke āhāre indriye jhāne
translated: in condition, three; in prenascence, one; in postnascence, in kamma, in result, in nutriment, in faculty, in absorption,

original: magge sampayutte vippayutte atthiyā avigate ekaṁ. (Evaṁ gaṇetabbaṁ.)
analyzed: magge sampayutte vippayutte atthiyāḥ avigate ekaḥ evam gaṇetabba
translated: in path, in association, in dissociation, in presence, in absence, in non-disappearance, one. (Thus should it be calculated.)

original: Anulomaṁ.
analyzed: anuloma
translated: In the forward order.

original: Paccanīyuddhāra
analyzed: paccanīya uddhāra
translated: The reverse order

original: Uppanno dhammo uppannassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena
analyzed: uppannaḥ dhammaḥ uppannassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena
translated: An arisen states is a condition, as object condition, for an arisen states …🔽is a condition, as conascence condition, for …🔽is a condition, as support condition, for …

original: paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … purejātapaccayena paccayo … pacchājātapaccayena
analyzed: paccayo upanissaya paccayena paccayo purejāta paccayena paccayo pacchājāta paccayena
translated: is a condition, as prenascence condition, for …🔽is a condition, as postnascence condition, for …

original: paccayo … āhārapaccayena paccayo … indriyapaccayena paccayo.🔽Anuppanno dhammo uppannassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo, upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccayaḥ āhāra paccayena paccayaḥ indriya paccayena paccayaḥ  anuppannaḥ dhammaḥ uppannassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: is a condition, as nutriment condition, for …🔽is a condition, as faculty condition, for …🔽An unarisen states is a condition, as object condition, for an arisen states, as support condition.

original: Uppādī dhammo uppannassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo.🔽1.18.7.2. Paccayapaccanīya🔽Saṅkhyāvāra🔽Suddha
analyzed: uppādī dhammaḥ uppannassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ 🔽paccaya paccanīya 🔽saṅkhyāvāra 🔽suddha
translated: An arising states is a condition, as object condition, for an arisen states, as support condition.

original: Nahetuyā tīṇi, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… navippayutte tīṇi, noatthiyā dve, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi, noavigate dve. (Evaṁ gaṇetabbaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā tīṇi na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā tīṇi pe na vippayutte tīṇi no atthiyā dve no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi no avigate dve evam gaṇetabba
translated: With respect to non-cause, there are three. With respect to non-object, there are three. With respect to non-predominance, there are three. … With respect to non-concomitance, there are three. With respect to non-presence, there are two. With respect to non-deprivation, there are three. With respect to non-disappearance, there are two. (To be calculated in the same way as above.)

original: Paccanīyaṁ.🔽1.18.7.3. Paccayānulomapaccanīya
analyzed: paccanīya  paccaya anuloma paccanīya
translated: The reverse order.🔽… In the reverse order of conditionality.

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… nonatthiyā novigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: hetu paccayā na ārammaṇe ekam pe no natthiyāḥ no vigate eka
translated: With respect to cause as condition, there is one as object. … With respect to non-deprivation, there is one. With respect to non-disappearance, there is one.🔽In the forward order of conditionality.

original: Anulomapaccanīyaṁ.🔽1.18.7.4. Paccanīyānuloma
analyzed: anuloma paccanīya  paccanīya anuloma
translated: … In the forward order.

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi, sahajāte ekaṁ, aññamaññe ekaṁ, nissaye🔽ekaṁ, upanissaye tīṇi, purejāte ekaṁ, pacchājāte ekaṁ, kamme vipāke āhāre indriye
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi sahajāte eka aññamaññe eka nissaye  eka upanissaye tīṇi purejāte eka pacchājāte eka kamme vipāke āhāre indriye
translated: With respect to non-cause as condition, there are three as object. There are three as predominance. There is one as conascence. There is one as mutuality. There is one as support.

original: jhāne magge sampayutte vippayutte atthiyā avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: jhāne magge sampayutte vippayutte atthiyā avigate eka
translated: There is one as nutriment. There are three as faculty. There is one as path. There is one as association. There is one as dissociation. There is one as presence. There is one as non-deprivation. There is one as non-disappearance. There is one as non-disappearance.

original: Paccanīyānulomaṁ.
analyzed: paccanīya anuloma
translated: In the reverse order of conditionality.

original: Uppannattikaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: uppanna ttikam niṭṭhita
translated: The section on the present is finished.
